quotes: She took office on 1 March 2021, becoming the first woman and African to serve as Director-General.
Dr. Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala also served on The Rockefeller Foundation board of trustees in 2009.
Dr. Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is former Minister of Finance for the Federal Republic of Nigeria, appointed in July 2011.
From September 2006 to November 2007, she was Distinguished Visiting Fellow at Brookings Institution.
From June to August 2006, she was Minister of Foreign Affairs of Nigeria, overseeing Nigeria’s External Relations;
from July 2003 to June 2006 she served a prior term as Minister of Finance and Economy of Nigeria
In October 2005, she led the Nigerian team that negotiated the cancellation of 60% of Nigeria’s external debt ($18 billion) with the Paris Club.
This included two tours of duty (1997-2000) working in the East Asia Region during the East Asian financial crisis;
